title: Bug 12428 - Pull Up: Confusing message
description: Bug 12428 - Pull Up: Confusing message. Shouldn't it be 'Copy method 'void setUp()' FROM type 'TestCase'' (also with uppercase C in Copy). Another thing: if I select to delete setUp from TestCase, I get under TestCase the message 'Delete method 'void setUp()' declared in type 'junit.framework.TestCase'. (Markus)
OB: The message displayed during the 'Pull Up' operation is confusing and contains a grammatical error. Additionally, when attempting to delete 'setUp' from 'TestCase,' the displayed message is inaccurate and refers to the wrong type.
EB: The message during the 'Pull Up' operation should correctly state 'Copy method 'void setUp()' FROM type 'TestCase'' with a corrected uppercase 'C' in 'Copy'. When deleting 'setUp' from 'TestCase,' the message should accurately state 'Delete method 'void setUp()' declared in type 'TestCase'.
SR:
1. Run 'Pull Up' on 'TestCase.setUp' (copies the method to Assert).
2. Go to the 2nd page of the wizard.
